tit.cmt: 左記訳語を検索したところ、他のカテゴリで登録があったため、天皇のカテゴリでも同一の訳語最雲法親王→Imperial Prince Saiunho (Saiun Hosshinno)を登録しましたが、別途、法親王で検索したところ異なる訳語が散見され、適切であると判断した下記の用語を用いました。(こちらはWeb には未登録です）最雲法親王→Monk Imperial Prince Saiun

sen.j: 最雲法親王（さいうんほっしんのう、長治元年（1104年） - 応保2年2月16日 (旧暦)（1162年3月3日）は、平安時代中期の天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Monk Imperial Prince Saiun (1104-March 3, 1162) was a monk of the Tendai sect in the middle of Heian period.
Monk Imperial Prince Saiun (1104-March 3, 1162) was a monk of the Tendai sect in the middle of Heian period.
Cloistered Imperial Prince Saiun (1104 - March 10, 1162) was a monk of the Tendai sect of Buddhism in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 比叡山に上り、天台座主仁豪に師事して出家・受戒し、仁実僧正から顕教・密教を学んだ。
sen.e: He went up to Hiei-zan Mountain, and became a priest and received religious percepts under Tendai-zasu Ningo (head priest of the Tendai sect); he also learned Kenkyo (esoteric Buddhism) and Mikkyo (esoteric Buddhism) from Ninjitsu Sojo (high Buddhist priest).

He went up to Mount Hiei-zan, and became a priest and received religious percepts under Tendai-zasu Ningo (head priest of the Tendai sect); he also learned Kenkyo (esoteric Buddhism) and Mikkyo (esoteric Buddhism) from Ninjitsu Sojo (high Buddhist priest).

He went up to Mt. Hiei to become a priest and receive the commandments of Buddhism with having Ningo, who was the head priest of the Tendai sect, as his teacher, and then he learned the Exoteric Buddhism and the Esoteric Buddhism from Ninjitsu, who was a sojo (a high-ranking Buddhist priest).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 1156年（保元元年）延暦寺座主に就任し、1158年（保元3年）には僧正に任じられ、親王宣下を受けて法親王となった。
sen.e: In 1156, he assumed the post as zasu （temple's head priest）of Enryaku-ji Temple, and was assigned to sojo in 1158; he was announced as the Imperial Prince and became the Monk Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: 大変申し訳ないのですが入力の誤りで、延暦寺座主→zasu （temple's head priest）of Enryaku-ji Temple と登録するつもりが、延暦→zasu （temple's head priest）of Enryaku-ji Temple 登録してしまいました。申し訳ないのですが削除をお願いできないでしょうか？お手数をおかけします。（正しい用語は登録済みです）
sen.e: In 1156, he assumed the post as zasu （temple's head priest）of Enryaku-ji Temple, and was assigned to sojo in 1158; he was announced as the Imperial Prince and became the Monk Imperial Prince.

In 1156, he assumed the position of zasu (the head priest) of Enryaku-ji Temple, and then he was assigned to a sojo and he became Cloistered Imperial Prince by the Emperor's official announcement in 1158.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました

sen.j: 同じ年座主の職を辞して山房に閑居、座禅看経の生活を送った。
sen.e: In the same year, he left the post of zasu, went to live in mountains spending his time for Zen sitting meditation and reading Buddhist scriptures.
In the same year, he left the post of zasu, went to live in mountains spending his time for Zen sitting meditation and reading Buddhist scriptures.
In the same year, he left the position of zasu and moved to a cottage in a mountain to spend the rest of his life sitting in Zen meditation and reading Buddhist scriptures.
